metadata.Title: CVE-2017-13064 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
GraphicsMagick 1.3.26 has a heap-based buffer overflow vulnerability in the function GetStyleTokens in coders/svg.c:311:12. It was discovered that GraphicsMagick incorrectly handled certain image files. An attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service or other unspecified impact.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-13064` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

graphicsmagick - 1.3.18-1ubuntu3.1+esm3
graphicsmagick-imagemagick-compat - 1.3.18-1ubuntu3.1+esm3
libgraphics-magick-perl - 1.3.18-1ubuntu3.1+esm3
libgraphicsmagick++3 - 1.3.18-1ubuntu3.1+esm3
libgraphicsmagick3 - 1.3.18-1ubuntu3.1+esm3
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: graphicsmagick package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.3.18-1ubuntu3.1+esm3').
